nodes.bodyText: please move into a service
Done, thanks!
please move into a service
Done, thanks!
please avoid Transactional
I think we need Transactional here since we write to the database

A resource should only check if the request is valid.
All processing logic (including db read and save) that is not necessary to checking the validity of the request should be done in a service
The request is not valid, if there should not be a job running for the exercise.

nodes.bodyText: I think we can even skip this part. This should be done before assessing each submission. so only exit if there are < 10
Not sure what @Profile does here. But I am happy to keep it if it does anything.
According to my research, it does not do anything in this case. I removed it
Please use the JUnit assertThat or assertEquals methods.
Can we remove transactional?
Afaik not. We otherwise cause a LazyInitializationException

Then you need to load all related objects from the database so that the operations can take place without such exceptions. We really would like to avoid @transactional in such cases, because loading proxy objects from the database is quite performance intense

Do we need this actually?
Afaik yes. We otherwise cause a LazyInitializationException
We use RestTemplates for all other external connectors. Would this be possible here as well?
We actually use a RestTemplate here with this special set of Headers

Yes, but as far as I can see, you do not inject it and you do not use an Interceptor here.
Have a look how this is done in BambooService, BambooAuthorizationInterceptor and in RestTemplateConfiguration.
I would prefer that we use a consistent approach for the communication with external systems.

This should be trimmed to the headline length to be consistent with the rest of our docs:

nodes.bodyText:
we are now using camelCase for those variables.
Why is this one protected and not private?

this comment is not really helpful. Can you explain why you copy those elements?
Why is the method called submissionDTOs if there are no real DTOs involved here?
I would rather call this method clone or copy

do we really need log.info here? And if yes, I would propose to add some additional information, e.g. which exerciseId is involved, how many results are processed, etc. otherwise the log does not really help

do we really need log.info here? And if yes, I would propose to add some additional information, e.g. which exerciseId is involved, how many results are processed, etc. otherwise the log does not really help
please call the object in AtheneDTO TextBlockDTO to avoid confusion here
t is not a good variable name
a bit more documentation would be nice.

I would turn this around to avoid null pointer exceptions in case auth is null:
If (!atheneApiSecret.equals(auth)) {
please use private attributes and getters and setters here
please use private attributes and getters and setters here
We are not consistent with how we handle this for DTOs in the code right now. I'd argue for dump DTOs that it is unneeded to add getters/setters.

why do you mock the repositories and services here? Please work with the actual repositories and services and rather mock the communication with Athene using restTemplates and mockProviders. Have a look at BambooRequestMockProvider
Also mocks here have the disadvantage that they significantly increase the test execution time, because the Artemis server needs to be restarted before this test is executed and needs to be restarted again after this test has been executed

I consider ReflectionTestUtils.setField bad practice here.
Instead let the application-artemis.yml in the test folder set those values for test cases automatically
you don't need to mock a repository. just work with the actual database by saving the above exercise to the database!
can we use a better name here and append DTO?
Codacy found an issue: The instance method name 'findByParticipation_ExerciseIdAndSubmittedIsTrue' doesn't match '[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9]*'

     @EntityGraph(type = LOAD, attributePaths = { "result", "result.assessor", "blocks" })
     Optional<TextSubmission> findByResult_Id(Long resultId);
+

+     * @param exerciseId the Id of the exercise
+     * @return List of Text Submissions
+     */
